63//*****************************************************************************
64//
66//
67//*****************************************************************************
68//
69// By spec and convention, the standard __FILE__ compiler macro includes a full
70// path (absolute or relative) to the file being compiled. This makes recreating
71// binaries virtually impossible unless rebuilt on the same or identically
72// configured system.
73//
74// To be able to build consistent binaries on different systems, we want to make
75// sure the full pathname is not included in the binary. Only IAR EWARM provides
76// an easy mechanism to provide only the filename without the path. For other
77// platforms, we will simply use a generic pathname.
78//
79#if defined (__IAR_SYSTEMS_ICC__)
80//
81// With EWARM the --no_path_in_file_macros option reduces __FILE__ to only the
82// module name. Therefore this define assumes the option is being used.
83//
84#define DBG_FILENAME __FILE__
85#elif defined(__KEIL__)
86//
87// Keil provides __MODULE__ which is simply the module name portion of __FILE__.
88//
89#define DBG_FILENAME __MODULE__
90#elif defined(__ARMCC_VERSION)
91#if (__ARMCC_VERSION >= 6000000)
92#define DBG_FILENAME __FILE_NAME__
93#else
94#define DBG_FILENAME __MODULE__
95#endif
96#else
97//
98// With GCC, we're out of luck.
99//
100#define DBG_FILENAME "debug_filename.ext"
101//#define DBG_FILENAME __FILE__
102#endif
103

109#ifndef AM_HAL_DEBUG_NO_ASSERT
110
111#define am_hal_debug_assert_msg(bCondition, pcMessage) \
112 if ( !(bCondition)) am_hal_debug_error(DBG_FILENAME, __LINE__, pcMessage)
113
114#define am_hal_debug_assert(bCondition) \
115 if ( !(bCondition)) am_hal_debug_error(DBG_FILENAME, __LINE__, 0)
116
117#else
118
119#define am_hal_debug_assert_msg(bCondition, pcMessage)
120#define am_hal_debug_assert(bCondition)
121
122#endif // AM_DEBUG_ASSERT
